comment: Professor Lindsays class was super easy. Even though he doesnt teach much in his lectures, everything was online; homework, quizzes, tests. The homework had unlimited tries, the quizzes & tests both had 2 attempts. It is kind of a self taught class but I would try to find some friends to take the quizzes/tests with. Super easy class.
very very boring class sign in sheet at the end of class all test and quizzes and homework is online one group project very easy he gets a little confused sometimes

If you are a student that likes to sit in the back of the class, then there is no way you will hear him. He is, also, disrespectful to his students. He likes to whistle at his students to get their attention and as he hears talking, he will stop class to yell at the student, even if you are working on the project. I would never recommend him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Lindsay knows how to perform statistics very well, but he isn't always very clear when answering others' questions. He can be hard to hear during lectures and fairly monotone overall, which means you may need to refresh on your own time. There is a major group project throughout the semester that should not be treated lightly.

Go to the classes for attendance grade. The class is pretty easy but its hybrid and I learned best by studying independently. You have a huge group project worth most of your grade. Keep up with the HW. All tests and quizzes are open book. The final you get to make one page of notes front and back that you take in class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: His class was not hard. Mostly everything in class he teaches I had to teach myself through google and other sources. The only challenge was a group project that we had to do all semester long, and it was only because my group would hardly participate and I ended up doing most of the work. Got an A and I am in no means a math wiz. Show up and study
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Very hard to hear in lecture, which makes it hard to follow. He's still nice and helpful though. Definitely an easy A for stat 1107.

Prof Lindsay is a pretty decent professor. He's very understanding and cares about students. Everything is online on Connectmath. Only the final is taken in class online. All tests and quizzes are taken at home. Super easy A!

Nice professor overall. We had a group project throughout the entire semester which was really annoying but easy if you did the work. Everything is online and you get two attempts on all major assignments and unlimited attempts on hw. Attendance is not mandatory and you basically have to teach yourself anyways.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I really enjoyed this class. This teacher really seems to care and wants to see his students do well. I am horrible at math and did great. I actually really came to love statistics. I enjoyed working in connectmath it is so helpful. I highly recommend this teacher. You have to work for your grade, but it's not hard if you put in the work.
If you take your time to do the homework you'll pass every quiz, test and it also helps towards the final. He's one of my favorite professors so far.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Lindsay was a pretty run of the mill stats professor.  It was a 2 hour and 45 minute long class, he would often dismiss us after an hour and a half.  All of the assignments are online through connectmath, which I found to be a pretty tolerable website. All exams and quizzes are open book/notes. One of the easiest math classes i've taken.

Prof Lindsay was wonderful, for those who aren't great at math he really makes the subject matter easy to understand. I would tell anyone who is not great at math to take him without a doubt! Great professor hands down.

Don't miss class, he takes attendance and you need the given group project time he gives you. And, don't fall behind, there is too much to try to catch up on. Assignments are laid out very clearly from the beginning and he is always willing to help one on one. I would take again.

He is a great professor and will take the time to help you understand the material if you take the time to wait to talk to him. He is also willing to meet outside class time to help you. The group project can be a pain, but don't over think it. Simple enough you don't need a partner. He will help you with it as well. I suggest using Stats tutoring.

I was skeptical at first taking a statistics class but get the book and do the examples for the chapters. It'll really help with online HW and assignments. Group project takes the whole semester but he is very helpful. Final is online done in class. Overall very good professor, if you need help he will stay after to go over what you missed.

All of his assignments are online, including the final, even though his class is technically considered a "lecture". He always lectures a chapter ahead of his assignments so do your homework and quizzes in class. There is a group project that lasts the whole semester, but he'll help you through the whole thing.

He lectures for 45-60min and then you break up into your group project.  Always ask questions if you don't understand, he will help you. Your lecture for the most part coincides with the different requirements of your project (which is just statistic problems). EVERYTHING is online and open book :) even though it's not an online .

Dr. Lindsay is a really nice man; he's definitely here to help. His class is easy if you do the work. There's no reason to get anything less than a 100 on the homework, and As on all the quizes. Everything is online, and everything has a due date. Attendance is not mandatory, but after a certain amount of absences, it begins to affect your grade.

I cannot understand anything he tries to teach in class, but attendance is mandatory. I suggest headphones and doing the online homework during his lecture. Thankfully the book is very explanatory and connectmath homework is extremely helpful. Might as well be an online class.

Hate math with a purple passion!!! However, I managed to get a B in Dr. Lindsay's Stats class, partly because the quizzes, tests and homework are all online. It also helped that Dr. Lindsay as very accessible (I called and texted him often) and very, very helpful. If you need help, just ask for it!

Prof. Lindsay is the worst math professor I have ever had. He hurriedly lectures for an hour and then we have to "get with our groups" for the other hour.I spend that time trying to interpret the lecture and teach each other. He's two chapters ahead of the schedule that our homework/quizzes/exams are due.If we have a question he says "Google it".

He never made the class a syllabus, and changed dates of quizzes/tests often. Also (I'm not sure if he'll still do this) but he had ALL of his quizzes & tests online, so if you did the homework (also online) you could easily do well. Overall the prof seemed like he was still trying to get the hang of things, but he'll go out of his way to help you.

Oh my gosh... Probably the WORST teacher ever. He didn't create a syllabus so the entire class was confused the entire semester. He makes you buy stuff for online homework but then says that it's not mandatory to do it. Confusing as hell. Whatever you do, do NOT take him.

At first the course seems easy when it came to descriptive statistics, but as we went deeper into more complex material I felt as if he was confused and that caused myself to also be confused. Writes terribly, not that great at technology (yet uses it on and off-inconsistent), and there are no exam reviews. "Pop quizzes" are ungraded notes.

VERY helpful and encouraging. Also, he was SO nice and understanding and willing to alter things according to needs. DEFINITELY take him. He goes thru material slowly and makes sure you understand it. A little "everywhere" sometimes. But he's an EASY B, and probably even an A. :)

I highly recommend Professor Lindsey. I dreaded taking statistics but he made this class interesting and was super helpful. He pulls 80% of the material for the exams from the pop quizzes which are not graded and gone over in class. He also drops your lowest exam. As long as you study the pop quizzes you will  have a no problem getting an A.

This professor is the worst math teacher I have ever had. I usually do alright in math but he wrote in chicken scratch, didn't give examples to work during class, his tests were hardly similar to the material in lectures and he doesn't even count the online homework or pop quizzes. On the tests he doesn't explain what you got wrong. DO NOT TAKE!!!!

Prof Lindsey was Great, I would definitely recomment taking him. I am HORRIBLE in math and dreaded taking this course. But Prof Lind was always available to answer questions, and he made the material easy to learn.. TAKE HIM

Dr. Lindsay was extremely helpful in stats. I hate all math so was not looking forward to this class. Professor Lindsay made it somewhat interesting and fun. He wanted everyone to do well and did whatever he could to make that happen. I would definitely recommend him.
Prof. Lindsay is very easy going and helpful. He does want you to succeed and makes it easy for you to do so...you just have to meet him half way!! I LOVE Dr. Lindsay!!!

He is extremely helpful. There is a project but he tells you everything to do for it. He wants his students to succeed. Sometimes he forgets what he's doing but if you get him back on track, he is good at teaching. He is very fair with grading and responds quickly to emails. Recommended.

he is very helpful if you don't understand material.  sometimes goes off problem and starts explaining something else.  not a math person and right now have B. if i had to retake class i would take it from him again

I don't think he's that great of a professor.  Often, he works a problem on the board and then decides that it's not a good example and erases it.  Additionally, he can be condescending to people who have a hard time in math classes like myself.  I ended up getting a $35/hr. tutor and that's the only reason I passed this class.

really helpful. if you have any questions at all, not only does he answer them in class, but he will meet you before/after at any  time. really nice, just wants everyone to know that statistics isn't as hard as other teachers make it
I really loved Professor Lindsay! I am terrible at math...terrible. But this professor was very easy to understand and very helpful!

Dr. Lindsay is extremely helpful.  He cuts out extraneous info not needed for a 1st-level stats course.  Book is only used for homework problems. If you ask for help, he is eager to help you understand. For the most part, you only have to know how to work the problems, not necessarily what they mean, it all makes sense in theend Highly recommended!

Mr. Lindsay is a great teacher! I had taken statistics before and failed it so I had to retake it. I was not looking forward to it and I really only cared about passing, even with just a C. I came out with an A+ in his class! He takes time to work with students after class which really helped me. I definitely recommend him!
